executive_summary.title: Executive Summary
executive_summary.overview: This Climate Change Risk Assessment (CCRA) report analyzes climate-related risks across key strategic sectors. The assessment evaluates hazards, exposure, and vulnerability to determine risk levels and prioritize adaptation actions.
executive_summary.sections: The report contains five main sections:
executive_summary.section_1: 1. Methodology overview of risk calculations and scoring
executive_summary.section_2: 2. Top climate risks requiring immediate attention
executive_summary.section_3: 3. Complete risk assessment data across all sectors
executive_summary.section_4: 4. Qualitative assessment findings from stakeholder engagement
executive_summary.section_5: 5. Recommended next steps for climate adaptation

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.formula: Risk scores are calculated using the formula: Risk = Hazard x Exposure x Vulnerability, where each component is normalized on a 0-1 scale. Vulnerability considers both sensitivity and adaptive capacity indicators.
methodology.scoring: Scores are normalized within hazard groups to enable comparison, with risk levels defined as: Very High (>0.8), High (0.6-0.8), Medium (0.4-0.6), Low (0.2-0.4), Very Low (<0.2)

steps.1: Develop detailed adaptation strategies for high-risk sectors
steps.2: Engage stakeholders to validate findings and gather additional insights
steps.3: Identify funding sources for priority adaptation measures
steps.4: Establish monitoring systems to track risk indicators
steps.5: Update emergency response plans based on identified risks
steps.6: Integrate findings into city planning and policy development
